course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Confucianism in a Global Context
course.description: As the key to some of the secrets that underlie the contemporary success of the East Asian region, Confucianism has now been recognized as a "living" tradition that has indeed moved into the Western world along with the East Asian Diaspora, making it very much an active participant in the larger global community. This course is designed to introduce the growth and developments of Confucianism as a major intellectual tradition not only in East Asia, but also in the global age of today.
course.prerequisites: HUMA 2420 OR HUMA 1440 OR HUMA 2570 OR HUMA 2830 OR SOSC 2290

reviews.author: makaze
reviews.title: good grade chinese philo course
reviews.comment_content:
主要教儒家在歷史上的演變  孔子孟子 朱熹 王陽明
辛苦的是用英文讀論語 讀翻譯的版本
本身理解中哲已經好頭痛 重要英文讀 祝大家好運
不過文言文不好就入吧 個人覺得英文好過文言文

reviews.author: rei
reviews.title: boring course but fair grade
reviews.comment_content:
very boring, it is all about confucianism in different way, in ancient china, japan and korea
besides, it will compare confucianism with other ideology like mohism and legalism etc...
it is really boring, lecture doesn't help at all, you have to rely on the reading
the ppt is just copy and paste without edit from the reading
reviews.comment_teaching:
lecturer is monotone and very bad at presenting
he just read all the words provided on the powerpoint without any explanation
however, attendance is needed for every lesson and therefore all the students are needed to attend the course speechlessly
reviews.comment_grading:
very nice, even though I never listen to lecturer's word and seldom do I do the reading
finally I take the essential reading to the exam and I got a pretty well result in this course
besides final, there are presentation and 3000 words essay are needed for the course

class attendance + essay ~30%
presentation ~30%
final ~40%
reviews.comment_workload:
light workload compare to other 4000 level course
only a group work presentation is needed and after that 3000 words essay submit in regards to your present topic
and final
attendance take every lesson
no midterm
